title: AHA/ASA Scientific Statement 2021: Primary Care of Adult Patients After Stroke

recommendations.text: Image the carotid arteries in anterior circulation stroke events.
Obtain ECG to screen for atrial fibrillation.
Confirm diagnosis with brain imaging (CT or MRI).
Perform CBC, PT/INR, PTT, glucose, A1c, creatinine, and lipid profile to identify risk factors and guide therapy.
Recommend and facilitate optimal lifestyle practices (physical activity, weight management, smoking cessation, healthy diet).
Treat hypertension to a goal of <130/80 mm Hg for most patients.
Use high-intensity statin therapy (e.g., atorvastatin 80 mg) when indicated; target LDL-C reductions per guideline.
Target A1c <=7% for most patients with diabetes; select glucose-lowering agents with cardiovascular benefit when appropriate.
Provide multidimensional diabetes care (lifestyle, nutrition, self-management, medications) and facilitate weight management.
Use aspirin 325 mg daily for stroke related to 50%-99% intracranial stenosis.
Refer 70%-99% ipsilateral extracranial carotid stenosis for endarterectomy within 6 months; consider 50%-69% in selected patients.
Provide intensive medical therapy regardless of carotid surgery decisions.
Use oral anticoagulation for atrial fibrillation or flutter unless contraindicated.
Prefer DOACs over warfarin for nonvalvular AF, except with moderate-to-severe mitral stenosis or mechanical valves.
Use warfarin for AF with moderate-to-severe mitral stenosis or mechanical valves.
Support behavior change to improve stroke literacy, lifestyle, and medication adherence.
Address social determinants of health (literacy, language, affordability, food insecurity, housing, transportation) when managing risk factors.
Monitor population-level performance measures to identify and reduce disparities; use health literacy precautions for patient instructions.
For noncardioembolic ischemic stroke or TIA, use aspirin (50-325 mg), clopidogrel 75 mg, or aspirin-dipyridamole.
For minor stroke (NIHSS <=3) or high-risk TIA (ABCD2 >=4), use short-term DAPT (aspirin + clopidogrel) begun within 12-24 hours for 21-90 days, then single therapy.
